title: IntegrationQt/C++ Android App with Google Play Subscriptions
content:
We have a functioningQt/C++ app running on Android but not yet published.  We wish to add support for subscriptions to the app, mirroring the subscriptions we provide for the same app on IOS.  We are experienced developers and can handle all aspects ofQtuser interface.

We require a C++ module/library for interfacing with Google Play subscriptions and a sample app that demonstrates the functionality.  The module will interface with Java API's for purchasing, cancelling, querying status of user subscriptions.  The API will be general purpose in nature, although it may not need to handle aspects of Google Play subscriptions not required by our app.  The module will be 100% independent of our software.  We will likely choose to release the module as open-source.

We will use the C++ API to interface our app with Google Play store.  We will require guidance and help in packaging C++/Java code you write into our APK and related resources so the combined software can be successfully submitted to the Google play store for publication.

The successful developer will:
* Be familiar Google Play subscriptions
* Knowledgeable about interfacing C++/Qt/Java software
* Able to write robust, clean, readable, documented C++/Java code.
* Able to design a suitable general purpose C++ subscription API
* Familiar with packaging of Android apps for submission to the store
* Knowledgable about Google Play sand-boxing for validating our app.
* Communicate in English with experienced developers and assist with integration process.

Requirements
* Support a handful of monthly and annual subscriptions options.
* Allow discovery of subscription naming & pricing, allowing changes on the Play store to be reflected in our app.
* Make use of Google Play sandboxing so that the subscriptions may be validated prior to publication

The steps we plan to follow:
* Review our existing IOS app and subscriptions
* Propose a suitable C++ API.
* We will review and approve this API
* Implement C++ module and example app.
* We will validate this app and review the software.
* Assist with any questions during our integration
* Assist with any submission of our app to Google Play store

title: Debug and fix a C++ program withQtand LibTorch
content:
I have a tiny inference program on Python with PyTorch as an attachment. It can run well with a given model and some input images. I have converted the code into C++ to run with LibTorch andQt(using QImage). The new program is very small too, and can run fine with some input images. However, for some other input images, it may create some wrong/different outputs, compared with those running from the Python program. I have tested mainly on macOS.

Your job is to debug, find and fix theQtC++ program thus it can create a similar result (for given images, just a few 2-3 images) with the original one in Python.

It is a good idea if you can show me some evidence that you are good atQtand LibTorch.

Note: You are supposed to be a master of LibTorch andQt. Don‚Äôt ask me how to install or compile them. I have worked on my project for a while, tried some solutions, but not helped. That means it is not a very simple job at first glance - that is why I need help from good ones. I am not a newbie, and I don‚Äôt need work from a newbie.

title: UI Developer Required for Touchscreen Interface on Embedded Linux Device
content:
Description
We are looking for a freelancer to help us design and implement the foundational UI for a touchscreen-based embedded system. This is a technical interface for a lab-grade device, and the UI should be clean, responsive, and extendable.

Scope of Work
-Create a basic UI layout with placeholder sections (e.g., control panel, plots, logs)
-Add a splash screen that displays on boot
-Ensure the UI auto-launches on system startup
-Confirm USB touchscreen input works correctly
-Use a scalable framework (Qt/QML, Python + Kivy, PyQt, or similar)

Requirements
-Experience building UIs on embedded Linux platforms
-Familiarity with touchscreen interaction and layout design
-Proficiency inQt/QML, PyQt, or similar frameworks
-Ability to configure autostart and handle display + input devices
-Clean, modular code and strong communication

Nice to Have
-Experience with plotting or waveform display
-Familiarity with serial/I/O communication (SPI/UART/USB) for future integration

Deliverables
-Source code of the UI (with comments)
-Instructions for deployment
-Optional: setup script or Docker container

title: UI Developer for Audio-Visual Touchscreen Device (Linux + Flutter orQt)
content:
Project Overview:

We‚Äôre building a screen-based audio-visual player designed for young children. The hardware prototype is complete and fully functional ‚Äî powered by a Raspberry Pi CM4 running Linux.

We now need a UI-focused developer to implement the front-end experience. All backend and hardware logic (e.g., sensors, buttons, WiFi scanning, power control) is already handled in a lightweight service. Your role is to create a delightful, polished touchscreen interface that‚Äôs intuitive, fast, and ready to grow into a larger product ecosystem.

What This Job Is (and Isn‚Äôt):

‚úÖ YES ‚Äî It's mostly front-end UI work
You‚Äôll build a touch-optimized media interface using Flutter orQtYou‚Äôll read from simple text files on the system to get state updates (e.g., button press, WiFi info)
You'll control local audio/video playback, UI transitions, and power states
The UI will eventually support a content library and subscription model

‚ùå NO ‚Äî You don‚Äôt need to build or touch the firmware
No low-level hardware programming
No GPIO, driver, or kernel work
No device prototyping or electrical work

Responsibilities:

üé® UI Development (Main Focus)
Build a responsive UI (Flutter orQt) for use on a 5.5‚Äì6‚Äù touchscreen
Display a grid of media thumbnails (think: children‚Äôs stories)
Implement tap/play interactions, visual feedback, transitions, and idle behavior
Enable basic functions: sleep, play/pause, resume, exit

üß© Light Backend Integration
Read prewritten files from the local file system to update UI (e.g., list of stories, battery state)
Pass simple playback commands by writing to system-monitored files
No networking or sockets required

Tech Stack:
OS: Linux (ARM64), Raspberry Pi CM4
UI: Flutter (preferred) orQtLanguage: Dart or C++/Python
Media: MP3/MP4 (local playback only at this stage)
Integration: File-based IPC

Ideal Candidate:
Experience with embedded or device UI development
Ability to turn static designs into simple, polished, responsive experiences
Knowledge of Linux file handling (open, read, write)
Understands performance trade-offs on lower-resource hardware (RAM, battery)
Clear communicator and able to work independently

Nice-to-Haves:
Audio/video playback experience on Linux
Experience designing interfaces for children or accessibility
Familiarity with Raspberry Pi or similar single-board computers

What We Provide:
Fully working hardware prototype
Backend systems running (sensor logic, power, WiFi, etc.)
UI design files (Figma or static assets)
Clear requirements and milestones
Weekly calls with the project owner

To apply please include:
A short note about your interest and availability
Examples of past UI work on hardware, embedded, or media products
Anything you‚Äôve built with Flutter,Qt, or for Linux-based systems

title: C++ VLC Media Player Developer (Qt6 - Custom Desktop Player, Netflix-like UI)
content:
Description:

We are seeking an experienced C++ developer to build a custom desktop media player application using libVLC (VLC SDK) with aQt6-based modern user interface.

The player will act as a dedicated client for a pre-existing API backend, fetching stream information and handling media playback via VLC engine integration, while providing a custom, Netflix-style desktop user experience.

This is not a generic player, but a specific purpose streaming client with a custom UI and essential player controls.
Core Requirements:

    C++ (modern C++17 or newer)Qt6 (Widgets or QML) UI framework experience

    libVLC (VLC SDK) integration

    Implementation of core player features:

        Play / Pause

        Seek / Progress bar

        Volume control

        Fullscreen toggle

        Subtitle selection

        Audio track switching

        Video quality handling (HLS, DASH support via VLC)

        Keyboard shortcuts

    API interaction (REST API or JSON-based endpoints provided)

        Fetch media details (URL, metadata, subtitles, etc.)

        Authenticate session, manage tokens

Bonus Skills (nice to have):

    Familiarity with Netflix-style UI design patterns

    Custom controls and skins development inQtExperience with performance optimization in streaming applications

    Cross-platform deployment experience (Windows & macOS)

    Packaging the application as .exe and .app including VLC runtime

Deliverables:

    Full cross-platform C++ source code with CMake project setup

    Functional desktop builds for Windows & macOS

    Complete working UI with all controls fully implemented and tested

    Deployment documentation (build, install, configure)

    Integration with provided API (authentication, stream fetching, etc.)

Important Notes:

    No usage of C#, .NET, or Electron ‚Äî pure C++ /Qt6 only.

    This is a desktop-only application, no mobile development involved.

title: Help me polish my python desktop app. Looking for a partner willing to work long term for equity.
content:
Hi! I‚Äôm looking for a skilled Python developer with experience working with the dxcam (DirectX camera) library to help solve a specific crash issue in my desktop app, help polish my app to make it releasable quality, and potentially work long term with me as a partner for project equity.

Context:
I built a desktop app called LobbyBot, which lets users customize and play their own music while waiting in lobbies for games like Valorant and Fortnite. It accesses the game‚Äôs timing and screen states using the dxcam library for pixel capture.

However, there‚Äôs a problem: when alt-tabbing out of Valorant, the game changes screen resolution or display mode (as Valorant often does), and that breaks dxcam, which causes a chain reaction of errors and crashes the entire app. Since users often alt-tab to control their music or multitask, this needs to be fixed for the app to be reliable.

What I need:
I need someone who can investigate this issue and come up with a viable solution or reliable workaround. Whether it‚Äôs handling the alt-tab event more gracefully or adjusting how dxcam is initialized or used, I need the app to stop crashing during normal use. Also someone who can dedicate time to help me polish the app and make it releasable quality. It would also be a bonus if the candidate knows a bit about Overwolf and it's API.

Ideal skills:
- Strong Python knowledge
- Experience with desktop apps (e.g., PyQt5, Tkinter, or other GUI frameworks)
- Familiarity with the dxcam library or DirectX-based screen capture
- Debugging experience with Windows-specific behaviors

How I like to work:
- Clear communication through Upwork messages or chat
- I‚Äôll provide the current code and any logs or crash reports
- I‚Äôm open to suggestions on better practices or alternative approaches
- Prefer fast turnaround, but clean and stable code is most important

If you‚Äôve worked on similar bugs or have experience debugging system-level interactions in Python, I‚Äôd love to hear how you‚Äôd approach this.

Thanks!

title: Metrology Software Using Opencascade andQt
content:
Hi there,

I am trying to code aqtc++ desktop application for an probed optical cmm measurement device. I use the open cascade library for 3d kernel. Right now, I am using Fougue's Mayo git repository as base code but I think I won't be able to make a clean code.

The application will have this features:
- real time sampling (I can do that part) and visualising the probe on real-time
- creating basic geometries like plane, line circle etc. feature
- import cad data(step, iges) with GD&T feature
- visualize the geometries, shapes, gd&t features, 
- reporting the measurement feature

Some features are already done thanks to Mayo Application. 

the project can be divided to 3 milestones.
1st milestone is creating basic geometries, visualising the geometries and the probe on real-time, measuring distance or angle btw geometries, manuel tolerancing and reporting
 
2nd milestone is cad import-export, selecting basic geometries from the cad, calculating distance or angle, showing as bubble format,  reporting 

3rd difficult part :) GD&T integration

I can send the current source code. I have made some modifications on to the repository. I added a layer manager system which controls shape's color, transparency and visibility.

title: Drone Basestation Stack Forked from QGroundControl
content:
# üì° Zion Basestation Software ‚Äì Specification Document

## üß≠ Overview

Zion is a ground-control application forked from QGroundControl, designed for in‚Äëfield, offline-first operations. It empowers users to:

* Build and visualize global LiDAR maps
* Provision drones via Ansible
* Manage firmware and token-based access with cloud synchronization
* Plan and dispatch complex multi‚Äëdrone missions using a custom YAML schema

## üß± Architecture

* **Core**: C++/Qt(QGroundControl base)
* **Extensions**: Rust/Python (SLAM, token logic, Ansible orchestration)
* **UI**: QML/QtQuick (new pages under `Setup` & `Plan` views)
* **Build**: CMake +QtCreator
* **Networking**: Local WiFi (drone ‚Üî Zion), REST (Zion ‚Üî Cloud)
* **Storage**:

  * **SQLite** for tokens & sessions
  * **YAML** for mission plans
  * **Filesystem** for map data & firmware archives

---

## üó∫Ô∏è 1. LiDAR Map Builder

### üéØ Purpose

Aggregate raw point clouds from Scout drones into a single, interactive 3D map for mission planning.

### ‚öôÔ∏è Functionality

* **Input**: Raw point cloud files (format TBD by SW engineer)
* **Processing**: Invoke external SLAM backend e.g. Fast‚ÄëLIO2, Cartographer
* **UI**: `ZionMapView.qml` renders map over satellite imagery or grid
* **Output**: Map artifacts such as voxel grids, mesh, metadata stored for reuse

### üìå Notes

* Drone‚Äëside SLAM remains for collision avoidance only
* Global map generation exclusively on Zion

---

## ‚öôÔ∏è 2. Ansible Deployment System

### üéØ Purpose

Automate provisioning of Jetson compute modules and Mini‚ÄØPix flight controllers.

### ‚öôÔ∏è Functionality

* **Dynamic Templates**: Jinja2‚Äëbased playbooks per drone model
* **Targets**:

  * Jetson: OS packages, Rust runtimes, service daemons
  * FC: Firmware flashing via DFU over USB
* **UI**: `ZionDeployPage.qml` under `Setup` tab for inventory & status
* **Offline**: All assets such as playbooks and firmware cached locally

---

## ‚òÅÔ∏è 3. Cloud Communication & OTA Updates

### üéØ Purpose

Keep token balances, session logs, and firmware versions in sync with the cloud.

### ‚öôÔ∏è Functionality

* **REST API** endpoints:

  * POST /api/v1/sync\_tokens
  * GET /api/v1/balance?user\_id=id
  * GET /api/v1/firmware/latest
* **Download & Cache** firmware packages locally
* **Upload** session logs and telemetry when online
* **Network Resilience**: Retry & backoff on failures

---

## üîê 4. Token Access Control

### üéØ Purpose

Enforce pay‚Äëper‚Äëuse access:‚ÄØ**1‚ÄØToken = 1‚ÄØDrone = 24‚ÄØHours**

### ‚öôÔ∏è Storage (SQLite)

```sql
CREATE TABLE tokens (
  user_id TEXT PRIMARY KEY,
  balance INTEGER,
  last_sync TIMESTAMP
);

CREATE TABLE sessions (
  session_id TEXT PRIMARY KEY,
  user_id TEXT,
  drone_id TEXT,
  start_time TIMESTAMP,
  end_time TIMESTAMP,
  synced BOOLEAN DEFAULT 0
);
```

### üîÑ Sync Logic

* **Offline**: Check local balance before mission start
* **Online**: Push new sessions; pull updated balances
* **UI**: Display balance & active sessions on mission screen

---

## üß≠ 5. Mission Planning & Dispatch

### üéØ Purpose

Define, preview, and send custom missions to one or more drones.

### üìã YAML Schema

```yaml
mission_id: field_spray_001
drones:
  - id: DRONE_A
    waypoints:
      - position: [12.345, 67.890, 10.0]
        yaw: 180.0
        actions:
          - StartSprayer: flow_rate: 0.3
          - Hold: seconds: 10
      - position: [12.346, 67.891, 10.0]
        yaw: 90.0
        actions:
          - TakePhoto: resolution: "4k"
          - DescendTo: altitude: 3.0
```

### ‚öôÔ∏è Functionality

* **UI**: `ZionPlanView.qml` overlays map; drag‚Äëdrop waypoints
* **Drone Discovery**: Static IP, mDNS, or manual entry
* **Dispatch**: POST http\://drone\_ip/mission
* **Actions**: StartSprayer, Hold, TakePhoto, DescendTo, Land, WaitForSignal

---

## ‚úÖ Next Steps

1. Define raw LiDAR buffer spec
2. Select & integrate global SLAM backend
3. Create Ansible playbook templates
4. Scaffold SQLite token DB & sync client
5. Draft REST API specification
6. Build QML components for map, deploy, tokens, mission UI

---

## üìé Appendix

* **Drone Classes**: Scout (LiDAR), Worker (Sprayer), Hauler (Heavy Lift)
* **Local HTTP Server**: All drones host a REST endpoint for mission reception
* **Offline‚ÄëFirst**: Zion operates without connectivity; syncs when available

title: C++/QTDeveloper with Object detection AI/ML model integration
content:
We have our C++/QTapp with camera feed integration, we are going to implement Object detection model using OpenCV/PyTorch and Python programming.
Please apply to this job if you can help us in this project.

title: Development of a OpenCV Application for image based  Weld and Hole Inspection (Python, PyQt5)
content:
Please offer a fixed price milestones:

We are looking for an experienced software developer to build a structured and well-documented Python-based desktop application for image-based inspection of industrial parts.

The software will capture images from two USB camera (in future maybe more), detect and measure weld seams and elongated/circular holes, and document the results.
There are two sides of the Part that has to be checked. We think two detailed pictures are better than a total picture with bothsides. Every Check has to be 2 pictures that are OK.

Core Features:
- Camera calibration using a checkerboard or marker pattern (settings saved in config file)
- Live display of the USB camera feed
- Manual and automatic image capture
- Detection of part presence
- Detection and measurement of weld seams
- Detection and measurement of round and elongated holes
- Display of original and processed images side-by-side
- Overlay creation (measurement labels, highlighted features)
- Red/Green status indicator (part OK / not OK)
- Saving of images and results (CSV)

Additional Features:
- Configurable measurement thresholds (via config file)
- Input of job number, part counter, correction for rejected parts
- Triggering of image capture manually or automatically (e.g. when part is still-optional)
- Modular and maintainable source code with documentation

Future Addition:
For Future (next projekt) there are also 2 other faces with weldments that maybe should be intecrated.

Suggested Technology:
- Python 3.10+
- OpenCV 4.x
- PyQt5 (or PyQt6 as alternative)
- CSV export (Pandas optional)
- Modular structure, PEP8-compliant code

Proposed Project Structure:
/HousingCheckingApp/
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ main.py
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ config.py
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ camera/
‚îÇ   ‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ camera_controller.py
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ image_processing/
‚îÇ   ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ detection.py
‚îÇ   ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ calibration.py
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ ui/
‚îÇ   ‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ main_window.py
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ utils/
‚îÇ   ‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ file_utils.py
‚îÇ   ‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ logger.py
‚îú‚îÄ‚îÄ resources/
‚îî‚îÄ‚îÄ README.md

GUI Layout (Concept):
See attached

Proposed Milestones:
Phase 1: prove of concept (one Side - quick and dirty - input file - output: filterd image, image with markups)
Phase 2: Setup, camera connection, base GUI
Phase 3: Image processing, detection, overlay
Phase 4: Image saving & CSV export
Phase 5: Calibration
Phase 6: Configurable thresholds, job tracking counters
Phase 7: Optimization, testing, documentation


Attachments:
We will provide:
- Sample test images (good and bad parts)- Attached in Low quaity.
- A basic GUI mockup
- Process description


Freelancer Requirements:
- Experience in OpenCV-based vision systems is mandatory
- Please include examples of **similar projects**, preferably with screenshots or videos
- Please outline your proposed technical approach briefly (tools, structure, design ideas) not just a standard applikation text. It has to fit our requirements.
- The final delivery must include all source code and usage documentation

Please offer a fixed price milestones.

Follow-up collaboration possible for future extensions or maintenance.

title: Python Desktop App Developer ‚Äì Build GUI Around AI Model (PDF Symbol Detection)
content:
Here‚Äôs what I need:
I have a trained AI model that detects electrical symbols in construction drawings (PDF format). The model is already working and detects most symbols with around 75‚Äì90% accuracy. It also needs to give a quantity per symbol for example D1 Light Fitting ‚Äì 283 
________________________________________
Goal (Phase 1 ‚Äì Desktop App):
I want to turn this into a Windows desktop application that I can use on my local PC. I have a GeForce RTX 4070 GPU, so the app should use CUDA acceleration for fast detection.
This version is for internal use only so I can:
‚Ä¢	Test the AI model on real drawings
‚Ä¢	Manually correct AI mistakes (missed or mislabeled symbols)
‚Ä¢	Stress test the full workflow
‚Ä¢	Log every correction made, so the model can be retrained later with better data on a continuous basis. (If you have any ideas in regards to making the model more accurate or logging of changes ill be making manually, please let me know)
________________________________________
What the app should do:
1.	Let me drag and drop PDF drawings into the program
2.	Automatically run the AI model on the drawing
3.	Show me the PDF with bounding boxes over detected symbols in different colours for each symbol.
4.	Allow me to:
o	Delete wrong detections
o	Add missing symbols manually
o	Change labels of symbols that were mislabeled
o	When doing all of the above it automatically changes the quantitys of each symbol.
5.	Show a live count of each symbol type
6.	Export:
o	A marked-up PDF
o	A CSV or Excel file with total counts for each fitting and a small picture of the symbol.
7.	MOST IMPORTANT:
Every time I make a correction, I want the app to automatically save a log (e.g. corrections.csv or .json) that includes:
o	Drawing name
o	Page number
o	Symbol type
o	Coordinates (x, y, width, height)
o	The correction type (added / deleted / relabeled)
This file will be used by my AI developer to retrain and fine-tune the model based on my edits, or if you can do the following im happy to use you. Please let  me know if you can or cant.
________________________________________
Phase 2 ‚Äì Cloud SaaS Platform (After Testing):
Once this desktop version is working well and the model is accurate, I plan to turn it into a cloud-based web platform that customers can use. If this goes well, I'd like to work with you long-term on that too. Although if you can only do phase 1 please let me know as I‚Äôm happy with that also.
________________________________________
Tech Requirements:
‚Ä¢	Must run locally on Windows (standalone .exe)
‚Ä¢	Must use CUDA (GPU support) for fast AI inference (RTX 4070)
‚Ä¢	GUI can be in PyQt5, PySide2, or Tkinter
‚Ä¢	Use fitz (PyMuPDF) or similar to render PDFs with overlays
‚Ä¢	Packaged cleanly using PyInstaller or similar
‚Ä¢	This desktop program you will be creating does not have to look sleek or clean it needs to just do what I explained above as this is just a program so I can stress test the model with multiple drawings and then make the model as accurate as possible.
________________________________________
Next Steps:
Please send:
‚Ä¢	Examples of similar tools you've built (desktop apps, AI interfaces, etc.)
‚Ä¢	Your estimated timeline and fixed price (preferred)

Thanks,

title: C++ /QtSpecialist for Multi-Camera Video & Dante Audio Capture/Recording/Display (MVP)
content:
We seek a highly skilled and experienced C++ andQtdeveloper to build a Minimum Viable Product (MVP) for a media center application. This project involves developing a robust system for capturing, processing, recording, and displaying high-quality video and audio streams.

The core functionalities required for this MVP include:

Multi-Camera Video Capture: Implementing capture from multiple video sources via a Blackmagic Decklink 8K Pro capture card.
Multi-Channel Audio Capture: Integrating audio capture from multiple channels using a Dante Virtual Soundcard.
Configurable Video Recording: Developing a system to record the captured video streams to multiple hard drives based on predefined configurations (e.g., recording day).
Real-time Video Display: Displaying the captured video feeds on a screen using a visually appealing and responsive user interface built withQtand QML.
This project presents interesting challenges in real-time multimedia processing, hardware interaction, and performance optimization.

We are looking for a professional with the following qualifications:

Extensive C++ Experience: 5+ years of professional experience in C++ development.
StrongQtProficiency: Significant experience with theQtframework, including building modern and intuitive user interfaces withQtQuick (QML).
Multimedia Processing Expertise: Proven experience in solving problems related to audio and video processing, including capture, manipulation, and synchronization.
Performance Optimization: Experience optimizing software performance, including multi-core CPU utilization and leveraging GPU processing capabilities where applicable.
Hardware Interaction (Desirable): Experience working with hardware like capture cards (experience with Blackmagic products is a plus) and audio interfaces (understanding of Dante or similar audio-over-IP technologies is beneficial).
Problem-Solving Skills: Ability to tackle complex technical challenges in a multimedia processing pipeline.
MVP Mindset: Ability to focus on core requirements and deliver a functional MVP efficiently.
If you are a C++ andQtexpert with a passion for multimedia development and optimization, and you're looking for an interesting and challenging project, we encourage you to apply.

To be considered, please include in your proposal:

Your relevant experience with C++ andQt, specifically highlighting multimedia projects.
Examples of your work withQtQML for creating user interfaces.
Your experience with performance optimization techniques (CPU and GPU).
Any experience you have with video/audio capture hardware or technologies like Blackmagic or Dante.
Your proposed approach to tackling the key challenges of this project.
We look forward to reviewing your proposals.

Project Type: Fixed-Price or Hourly (To be discussed based on proposal)

Duration: (Estimate based on MVP scope - can be discussed)

Skills Required: C++,Qt,QtQML, Video Processing, Audio Processing, Multithreading, Performance Optimization, GPU Acceleration, Blackmagic Decklink, Dante, FFmpeg (potentially, depending on approach)

title: Web Developer Needed to BuildaSecondary Marketplace Platform
content:
:
I‚Äôm looking foraskilled web developer orasmall development team to buildasecondary marketplace platform where users can buy and sell pre-owned products (like [insert your niche here, e.g., electronics, fashion, or collectibles]).

This project involves designing and developingaresponsive, secure, and scalable website with modern UI/UX and backend functionality. It will include user accounts, listings,apayment system, and an admin panel.

‚∏ª

Core Features:
	‚Ä¢	User registration & login (email/social login)
	‚Ä¢	Product listing (upload images, write descriptions, set price)

	‚Ä¢	Admin dashboard (manage users, listings, content)

Tech Stack (Suggested but open to recommendations):

	‚Ä¢	Backend: Node.js (Express/NestJS) OR Django (Python)
	‚Ä¢	Database: PostgreSQL or MongoDB
	‚Ä¢	Hosting: Render / DigitalOcean / AWS / Vercel / Netlify
	‚Ä¢	Storage: AWS S3 or equivalent for product images
	‚Ä¢	Authentication: JWT or OAuth-based login
	‚Ä¢	Payment: Stripe, Razorpay, or PayPal integration

‚∏ª

Deliverables:
	‚Ä¢	Fully functional website
	‚Ä¢	Admin panel
	‚Ä¢	Deployment toalive environment (help with hosting setup)
	‚Ä¢	Documentation (technical and operational)
	‚Ä¢	(Optional) Ongoing maintenance or support

‚∏ª

Budget: $3,000 ‚Äì $6,000 (flexible based on expertise and approach)
Timeline: MVP within 4‚Äì6 weeks, full version in 8‚Äì12 weeks
Project Type: One-time project, with potential for long-term collaboration

‚∏ª

You Should Have:
	‚Ä¢	Experience building marketplaces or e-commerce websites
	‚Ä¢	Strong UI/UX sense and responsive design skills
	‚Ä¢	Experience with secure payment integrations
	‚Ä¢	Knowledge of hosting, deployment, and performance optimization
	‚Ä¢	Ability to suggest the best tech stack based on scale and budget

‚∏ª

To Apply:

title: Looking foraRadar Engineer
content:
We are looking foraRadar Expert International
Key Skills:
Radar System Expertise:
In-depth knowledge of Doppler radar, weather radar, and remote sensing technologies.
Proficiency in C-band, S-band, and X-band radar systems.
Expertise in signal processing, radar calibration, and performance optimization.
Experience in radar site selection, installation, and commissioning.
Structural and Electrical Engineering:
Understanding of structural load calculations, concrete pile strength assessment, and building retrofitting.
Ability to prepare Architectural, Electrical, Plumbing, and HVAC drawings for radar tower modifications.
Familiarity with building codes, electrical safety, and structural integrity assessments.
Project Planning and Documentation:
Experience in preparing technical specifications, equipment drawings, and training plans.
Skilled in drafting Feasibility Studies (FS), Development Project Proposals and cost estimates.
Strong technical writing and documentation skills.
Data Analysis and Signal Processing:
Knowledge of radar data processing, Doppler velocity analysis, and clutter reduction techniques.
Proficiency in using radar data for wind and rainfall estimation.
Ability to interpret radar reflectivity and velocity data for accurate weather forecasting.
Communication and Team Collaboration:
Strong interpersonal and communication skills for coordination with multidisciplinary teams.
Ability to present complex technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders.
Experience in conducting training sessions for radar operators and technical staff.
Education and Certifications:
Bachelor‚Äôs or Master‚Äôs degree in Electrical Engineering, Electronics, Atmospheric Sciences, Meteorology, orarelated field.
Professional certifications in Radar Technology, Remote Sensing, or Meteorological Instrumentation are highly desirable.
Familiarity with international meteorological standards (e.g., WMO, ICAO) is an advantage.
